Description: The sheet "Promoters vs Detractors (2019)" in the "Consolidated Cookbook" workbook on the "Default" project in the "890Portal" site compares people metrics for detractors and promoters. The data is sourced from the "Sheet1" table in the "Claim Data.xlsx" database using the "excel-direct" connection. The sheet has one column named "Detractor/Promoter" in the "Sheet1" table. Without further information, it is unclear what the values in this column represent.

The sheet named "Y-o-Y CSAT Comparison" in the workbook "Consolidated Cookbook" in the project "Default" in the site "890Portal" compares the customer satisfaction (CSAT) metrics for an organization and industry over multiple years. The data is sourced from a datasource named "Sheet1" which is connected to an Excel database named "NPS Metrics.xlsx" through a direct excel connection. The sheet contains three columns - "CSAT (Org)", "CSAT (Industry)", and "Year" - with data for each column coming from separate tables named "Sheet1".

The sheet "Cycle Times on Insurance Claim" in the "Consolidated Cookbook" workbook provides data on the cycle time and ID of insurance claims. The data is sourced from the "Sheet1" datasource in the "Claim Data.xlsx" database, connected through the "excel-direct" connection. The sheet has 2 columns - "CYCLE TIME" and "ID" - and the table name is "Sheet1". The sheet is part of the "Comparison of People Metrics" dashboard in the "Default" project on the "890Portal" site.

The sheet "Rural/Urban Distribution (2019)" in the workbook "Consolidated Cookbook" provides a comparison of people metrics based on urbanicity. The data is sourced from the "Sheet1" in the "Claim Data.xlsx" database, connected through the "excel-direct" connection. The sheet contains one column named "URBANICITY" and the table name is "Sheet1". Further details about the data and metrics being compared are not provided.

The sheet named "Y-o-Y NPS Comparison" in the workbook "Consolidated Cookbook" compares the Net Promoter Scores (NPS) of an organization with the NPS of the industry over the years. The data is sourced from a datasource named "Sheet1 (NPS Metrics)" which is connected to an Excel file named "NPS Metrics.xlsx" through a direct connection named "excel-direct". The sheet has three columns named "Year", "NPS (Org)", and "NPS (Industry)" and the table name for all three columns is "Sheet1".
